knimeNode.name: R Snippet
knimeNode.shortDescription: Allows execution of R commands on an R Server. The result of these R commands is returned in the output table of this node. The final result table will have only one column, named "R". Currently integers, doubles, and strings are supported held in lists, one-dimensional arrays, and single elements. (Matrix support will follow in a future version of KNIME.)

fullDescription.intro:
Allows execution of R commands on an R Server. The entire data (compatible to int, double, and String types) is transfered to the R Server which then executes a series of R commands entered in the dialog. Each column can be accessed by the name provided in the input data table. The output has to be assigned to a variable named R. Missing values are not supported yet.
R installation:
In order to get the R nodes running, you have to install the R-project first, see www.r-project.org. Also the R Server which responds to R commands has to be installed and running, see http://stats.math.uni-augsburg.de/Rserve
. Also make sure that you have the lastest available or compatible R-project version at hand. For Windows you may download an R Server for your R-project version. All other operating systems require the most recent clients (R-project installation). We offer downloads of current versions of R and R-Serve that are compatible with KNIME on our website. Please note that in the current version the R Server needs to be restarted from time to time. If an R node hangs, interrupt the R Server and restart it. Warnings and errors are printed in the R Server window.
fullDescription.option:
Enter R commands here, for instance for computing the Covariance of two columns:
R<-var(cbind(var(Col0,Col1))
The IP of the computer where the R Server is running, for example localhost with IP 127.0.0.1
The login name can be empty.
